review_text:
This house was perfect for our family of 8. There are 3 bedrooms. One has a king size bed. The other a queen size bed and the third had 2 twin beds with an extra foldable twin bed in the closet. We just brought a twin size air mattress so all 6 of our kids had a bed in a room.
The layout is strange, but there is plenty of room. The master bedroom looks like it might have been an old garage on the back of the house. There is a small tv room that you walk through to get to the master. You could probably sleep someone on the couch in there. There is an open living room/dining room as well. The kitchen is off of that.
There were some essentials in the kitchen cabinets and freezer, that we were welcome to use. The kitchen had plenty of dishes, cookware and utensils, which we rarely see at airb&bs for our family of 8. There was a blender, which our daughter appreciated, so she could have her breakfast smoothies. There were modern appliances in the kitchen. It had one of those drawer dishwashers.
The bathrooms were pretty modern. One had a big tile shower with glass enclosure. There was a normal shower head as well as a rain shower head. This bathroom also has a tub. The stackable washer and dryer are in this bathroom. The second bathroom has a tile shower that is flush with the bathroom floor. Half of the front has a tile wall and the other half a shower curtain. It is pretty modern. The kids appreciated it because they could brush their teeth while the other showered.
Parts of this house are older, but you can tell they have put a good bit of work into updating it. You do have to enter through the side door with a keypad. There is not one on the front door. Some of the houses in the neighborhood are rundown, but we felt very safe. It seems that there are many parts of Deming that have run down houses.
There is a small backyard with a grill that we did not use. It also has a covered patio with table and chairs. The entire backyard has a wall/fence around it. There is a back alley road between the houses.
We visited family in the area and would stay again in this house if we ever get to visit again.
Jennifer answered all our messages quickly. We had a lightbulb out in one of the rooms and she was sure to have that fixed immediately.

That is also true for Tina the Alpaca gently nibbling kibble from your palm and even a trio of Rheas taking a snip at your finger. In all, the farm's rescue and bred animals are gentle giants, and as some are rescued animals they are a bit shy. In the fields beyond the farm, we enjoyed the Gambel's Quail speed-stepping across the desert with their teensy golf-ball sized chicks furiously keeping pace, while Killdeer and Cactus Wren called from somewhere out in the pasture as they sheltered from the heat. As others have noted, Martin is an incredible host: patient, knowledgeable, exuberant. The cabin is comfortable, well-stocked with snacks and beverages, and comes with a guardBoots the house catwho will keep post outside your door all the starry night long. Yeah, it's a nice place to sleep. But it is itself a destination that you will be very happy you discovered.
